content: nnnnoooorrrrwwwweeeeggggiiiiaaaannnn sssseeeellllbbbbuuuu mmmmiiiitttttttteeeennnnssss my husband has family in norway and i have become obsessed with all the beautiful norwegian knitting this pattern is for a type of traditional mitten called selbuvotter the selburose the 8-pointed star is used in a lot of winter clothing especially in sweaters lusekofte and mittens votter traditionally these are knit in red and white or black and white but any two contrasting colors would work well i wasn t able to find a basic pattern written in english so i charted one based on pictures and wrote a simple pattern for it this is not my own pattern it was inspired by all the beautiful selbuvotter that i have admired for years there are so many variations on the selburose i encourage you to try others after completing this one if you use a non-superwash wool these will felt slightly with use…this is great because they ll be even warmer and more water-proof so wear them and enjoy them ©2018 stefanie canich norwegian selbu mittens page 1 gauge this pattern is written for an average sized woman s hand try going up a needle size or two for larger hands yarn 2 skeins dk weight 1 of each color needles us size 2/2 75mm us size 3/3 25mm this pattern is written for dpn s but can easily be converted to magic loop just split the stitches in half for the front and back stitches key k = knit p = purl mc = main color cc = contrasting color m1a = make one away ssk = slip slip knit k2tog = knit 2 together dpn = double pointed needles note there are two charts included in this pattern one is a classic chart with a front and back mitten that will need to be reversed for the left hand so the thumb is on the correct side the other chart has both the right and left sides so you just knit the side that you need for each mitten use the chart that makes the most sense to you pattern cast on 48 stitches using smaller needles in mc using a stretchy cast on such german twisted cast on k2 p2 for 20-25 rounds in whatever pattern you like for the cuff for example 10 mc 2 cc 3 mc 2 cc 6 mc if you prefer to use the larger needle size from the start co 44 stitches and increase 4 stitches evenly in the first plain round after the cuff switch to larger needles and knit one round in mc if you did the cuff in the smaller needle this is the round where you increase 4 stitches evenly then begin the colorwork pattern following the chart make increases for the thumb as shown to form the thumb gusset the orange dotted lines are marking convenient places to divide the stitches across your needles but it s not necessary to follow those guidelines do what works best for you all increases are
